channel.title: tastytrade: Options Jive
channel.description: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.itunes:subtitle: Learn to talk the talk - sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss trading topics of the day.
channel.itunes:author: tastytrade
channel.itunes:summary: If you want to trade like a tastytrader, you have to learn how to talk like a tastytrader. Sit down with Tom and Tony as they dish out and discuss popular trading topics that give you an edge when opening, closing and managing your trades.
channel.googleplay:author: tastytrade, Inc.

item.title: Judging Volatility
item.description: tastytraders are always on the lookout for high volatility opportunities to sell premium, but how can we tell if a given volatility is “high”? Today, Tom and Tony explain two normalized volatility metrics and use some data to help interpret them.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: tastytraders are always on the lookout for high volatility opportunities to sell premium, but how can we tell if a given volatility is “high”? Today, Tom and Tony explain two normalized volatility metrics and use some data to help interpret them.
item.content:encoded: tastytraders are always on the lookout for high volatility opportunities to sell premium, but how can we tell if a given volatility is “high”? Today, Tom and Tony explain two normalized volatility metrics and use some data to help interpret them.

item.title: How Long Does IVR Stay Bid
item.description: Since the start of the year, the major indices have seen their Implied Volatility Ranks (IVRs) over 50 quite frequently. 37% of the time for the S&P, 60% for the Nasdaq, and 47% of the time for the Russell.However, since volatility is mean reverting, it is unlikely that we see sustained periods of high IVR.When we see IVR start to increase, how long can we expect the indices to stay at or around that level before eventually decreasing?Join Tom and Tony to find out!
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.content:encoded: Since the start of the year, the major indices have seen their Implied Volatility Ranks (IVRs) over 50 quite frequently. 37% of the time for the S&P, 60% for the Nasdaq, and 47% of the time for the Russell.However, since volatility is mean reverting, it is unlikely that we see sustained periods of high IVR.When we see IVR start to increase, how long can we expect the indices to stay at or around that level before eventually decreasing?Join Tom and Tony to find out!

item.title: Black-Scholes Model: Runs Hourly vs Daily
item.description:
In the abstract world of the Black-Scholes model, underlying price movements should be self-similar: the statistical properties don’t change as you zoom in or out. But abstract theory only sometimes accords with reality. 

Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to compare runs on different time scales and see how close the market is to the models.

In the abstract world of the Black-Scholes model, underlying price movements should be self-similar: the statistical properties don’t change as you zoom in or out. But abstract theory only sometimes accords with reality. 

Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to compare runs on different time scales and see how close the market is to the models.

item.title: The Week That Was
item.description: SPX is currently in the same spot that it opened the week with but there was a whole lot that happened in the past five days. Tom, Tony and Jermal cover all the events that transpired this week.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: SPX is currently in the same spot that it opened the week with but there was a whole lot that happened in the past five days. Tom, Tony and Jermal cover all the events that transpired this week.

item.title: Volatility Across Expirations
item.description:
Changes in 30-day (typical) IV can affect short term options and the short term IV much more significantly, making them higher risk trading vehicles.

The move in short term IV tends to be a magnified version of what 30-day IV does. In future segments, we will show research on how these short term options actually perform if traded regularly.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade

item.content:encoded:
Changes in 30-day (typical) IV can affect short term options and the short term IV much more significantly, making them higher risk trading vehicles.

The move in short term IV tends to be a magnified version of what 30-day IV does. In future segments, we will show research on how these short term options actually perform if traded regularly.

item.title: Variance of PoP
item.description:
tastytraders look to the probability of profit when evaluating potential trades. While these probabilities might describe how many winning trades we’ll see in the long run, there are bound to be good years and bad years. 

Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to look at how different strategies have fared over the years.

item.itunes:subtitle: tastytraders look to the probability of profit when evaluating potential trades. While these probabilities might describe how many winning trades we’ll see in the long run, there are bound to be good years and bad years. Today, Tom and Tony dive i...

Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to look at how different strategies have fared over the years.

item.title: Should Indices Be Re-Weighed
item.description: The moves created by each of the FAANG earnings debate determine whether or not the indices need to be re-weighted. This is a matter of playing a game called long, short or trade with FB, TWTR and SNAP where you choose which will be trading higher a year from today and then decide which is the best to trade from a collecting standpoint.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: The moves created by each of the FAANG earnings debate determine whether or not the indices need to be re-weighted. This is a matter of playing a game called long, short or trade with FB, TWTR and SNAP where you choose which will be trading highe...
item.content:encoded: The moves created by each of the FAANG earnings debate determine whether or not the indices need to be re-weighted. This is a matter of playing a game called long, short or trade with FB, TWTR and SNAP where you choose which will be trading higher a year from today and then decide which is the best to trade from a collecting standpoint.

item.title: How Does A Stock Split Affect Us
item.description: With the upcoming Google stock split, many options traders will have access to a FAANG stock that was previously out of reach for many due to its high share price and buying power reduction. Any post-split returns or IV changes cannot be mathematically attributed to the stock split itself, and will continue to move in their usual unpredictable natures. Total notional value and open P/L for Google positions will not be affected by the split.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: With the upcoming Google stock split, many options traders will have access to a FAANG stock that was previously out of reach for many due to its high share price and buying power reduction. Any post-split returns or IV changes cannot be mathemati...
item.content:encoded: With the upcoming Google stock split, many options traders will have access to a FAANG stock that was previously out of reach for many due to its high share price and buying power reduction. Any post-split returns or IV changes cannot be mathematically attributed to the stock split itself, and will continue to move in their usual unpredictable natures. Total notional value and open P/L for Google positions will not be affected by the split.

item.title: Runs Short to Long
item.description: Premium sellers are naturally betting against large moves in the underlying and generally benefit from whipsaw price movements. But sometimes, for whatever reason, an underlying goes the same direction day after day. Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to look at how frequent and impactful these protracted runs can be.
item.itunes:author: tastytrade
item.itunes:subtitle: Premium sellers are naturally betting against large moves in the underlying and generally benefit from whipsaw price movements. But sometimes, for whatever reason, an underlying goes the same direction day after day. Today, Tom and Tony dive into ...
item.content:encoded: Premium sellers are naturally betting against large moves in the underlying and generally benefit from whipsaw price movements. But sometimes, for whatever reason, an underlying goes the same direction day after day. Today, Tom and Tony dive into the data to look at how frequent and impactful these protracted runs can be.

item.title: Spilling the Tea on Futures Trading
item.description:
A futures contract is a binding agreement between a buyer and a seller to buy or sell an asset at a fixed price at a predetermined future month. Just like options, one can trade in and out of them freely and they don’t have to be held until expiration day. Futures offer significant advantages over options and many traders should consider adding these tools to their portfolio.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they take a look at the advantages that futures offer over options and how they can compliment a portfolio.

item.content:encoded:
A futures contract is a binding agreement between a buyer and a seller to buy or sell an asset at a fixed price at a predetermined future month. Just like options, one can trade in and out of them freely and they don’t have to be held until expiration day. Futures offer significant advantages over options and many traders should consider adding these tools to their portfolio.

Join Tom, Tony and Jermal as they take a look at the advantages that futures offer over options and how they can compliment a portfolio.

item.title: A Strategy For A Sold Off Market
item.description: A jade lizard came from Liz and Jenny that created a middle-ground of two strategies: neutral price bias + no risk to the upside. This combination lets people capitalize on opportunity created by falling markets and high IV while giving the peace of mind that a whipsaw-up will not hurt you. Learn more about this strategy in today's episode with Tom and Tony.

item.title: Is Crypto Becoming Another Risk Asset
item.description:
Crypto is believed to be a diversifier for a traditional equity portfolio, but this year, it does not seem to be offering much assistance to overall performance.

With both the equity and crypto markets struggling to find an uptick to start 2022 off, we look at how the correlation between these two markets has changed in recent months.
